explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Although the flash point at 93 - 94 degC (Hommmel, Sax) is at the maximum, or outside of Category 4, there is other information, including 71 degC, 80 degC, etc., in another document (IUCLID (2000)). These may have been influenced by impurity dichloroethane (flash point: 13 degC). Also taking these commercial items into consideration, it was classified as as "Category 4".

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: It is not made a class 4.2 by UNRTDG. Aqueous solubility measurements is carried out. It is clear not to carry out an intense reaction, even if it contacts water.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 2 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE(ave.): 13.1mg/kg;

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on the rabbit dermal LD50 = 990mg/kg (DFGOT vol.15 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since saturated vapor at room temperature is about 500ppm, it was evaluated as gas. Rat LC50 converted for 4 hour is 32.13ppm and falls into Category 1. (When the same experiment was assumed to be steam and converted for 4 hours the value is 0.425mg/L and it is also Category 1.)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as "Category 2" based on IUCLID, etc.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was classified into "Category 2" based on IUCLID etc. There is no experimental data which distinguishes 2A and 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as "outside the categories" because it was negative in rat dominant lethal tests and there are no other in vivo data. It was also negative in the bacterial return modification test.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was judged as class 3 in IARC, and A4 in ACGIH, it was set as "Outside of Category."

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Although the ferotoxity of rat/mouse is observed only in the administration range occuring maternal toxicity (ACGIH (2001), but the material have extremely-high toxicity and it cannot be judged as the toxicity effect to mother is the only cause of the effect to embryo. R61 and R62 are attached by the category of EU. and it is classified into the "Category 2" by the above.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system); Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (central nervous system); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since the central nervous system effects are reported in laborers and the animals experiments, it was classified into "Category 1." Moreover, "Category 3" was added since the irritations of the nose and the throat are suggested (HSFS (2002)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (inhalation, nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since nervous system damage was seen in the gasoline inhalation addict, and the expert described that a major factor was a tetraethyl lead (Patty (5th.2001)), it was classified in "Category 1".

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.02mg/L of fishes (Bluegill) (EHC85, 1989).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and it is a metallic compound, behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.
